name: Cayman Islands
description: The Cayman Islands are a British Overseas Territory located in the western Caribbean Sea. Comprising three islands – Grand Cayman, Little Cayman, and Cayman Brac – they are renowned for their stunning coral reefs, turquoise waters, and luxurious tourism industry. The islands boast a unique blend of British colonial heritage, vibrant culture, and a thriving marine ecosystem.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city of Grand Cayman.
quickFacts.detail: Home to the historic districts, government buildings, and a vibrant waterfront.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A relatively small and closely-knit community.
quickFacts.detail: The population is primarily comprised of Caymanian descendants and expatriates.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: Linked to the US Dollar at a 1:1 ratio.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: The primary language spoken throughout the islands.
quickFacts.detail: Cayman Creole is also widely spoken and understood.

quickFacts.label: GDP per capita
quickFacts.description: One of the highest in the world.
quickFacts.detail: Driven largely by tourism and financial services.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A small but geographically diverse archipelago.
quickFacts.detail: Grand Cayman is the largest island, covering approximately 80% of the total area.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate
climateData.description: The Cayman Islands enjoy a consistently warm and humid tropical climate year-round.  Trade winds moderate temperatures, preventing extreme heat.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The hottest and most humid months, with frequent afternoon showers.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures remain warm, and rainfall decreases slightly. Hurricane season is at its peak.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The coolest and driest months, with average temperatures around 24°C (75°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures gradually increase, and rainfall returns.  A beautiful time to visit.

naturalWonders.name: Seven Mile Beach
naturalWonders.description: One of the most famous beaches in the Caribbean, renowned for its pristine white sand, turquoise waters, and lush palm trees. It offers a wide range of water activities and relaxation opportunities.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Stretching for seven miles along the western coast of Grand Cayman, Seven Mile Beach is a popular destination for tourists and locals alike. The beach is protected by a coral reef, creating calm and clear waters perfect for swimming and snorkeling.
viewingTips: Arrive early to secure a good spot

naturalWonders.name: Queen Elizabeth II Botanic Park
naturalWonders.description: A stunning botanical garden showcasing the diverse flora of the Cayman Islands and the Caribbean. It's a peaceful oasis with walking trails and a variety of plant species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located in the north of Grand Cayman, the Botanic Park features over 150 acres of lush gardens, including a medicinal plant garden, a hummingbird garden, and a butterfly glen. It's a great place to learn about the local ecosystem and enjoy the natural beauty of the islands.
viewingTips: Allow at least 2-3 hours to explore

naturalWonders.name: Undine Cave
naturalWonders.description: A spectacular underwater cave system accessible by boat, offering a unique opportunity to explore the Cayman Islands' fascinating marine geology.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located off the coast of West Bay on Grand Cayman, Undine Cave is one of the largest and most accessible underwater caves in the Caribbean. Divers can explore the cave's intricate formations, including stalactites and stalagmites, and encounter a variety of marine life.
viewingTips: Book a guided tour with a reputable dive operator

biodiversityCategory.name: Marine Ecosystem
biodiversityCategory.description: The Cayman Islands boast a remarkably diverse and healthy marine ecosystem, largely due to the protection of its coral reefs.

statistics.details: Protecting vital habitats for countless marine species.

notableSpecies.name: Hawksbill Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: A keystone species in the coral reef ecosystem, playing a crucial role in maintaining reef health.

notableSpecies.name: Caribbean Reef Shark
notableSpecies.significance: An apex predator that helps regulate fish populations.

ecosystemData.title: Coral Reef Ecosystem
ecosystemData.overview: The Cayman Islands’ coral reefs are a vibrant and essential part of the islands’ natural heritage. They provide habitat for a vast array of marine life, protect the coastline from erosion, and support the local tourism industry.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Ecosystem
biodiversityCategories.description: The foundation of the Cayman Islands’ biodiversity, supporting a rich array of marine life.

statistics.details: A significant portion of the reef is covered in healthy coral.
A wide variety of fish species inhabit the reef.

notableSpecies.name: Grouper
notableSpecies.significance: An important predator in the reef ecosystem.

notableSpecies.name: Parrotfish
notableSpecies.significance: Plays a vital role in maintaining reef health by grazing on algae.

activities.title: Outdoor Adventures
activities.description: The Cayman Islands offer a wide range of exciting activities for visitors and residents alike.

activityCategories.name: Diving & Snorkeling
activityCategories.description: Explore the stunning coral reefs and marine life of the Cayman Islands.

activities.name: Reef Diving
activities.description: Dive amongst colorful coral formations and diverse marine species.

activities.name: Snorkeling
activities.description: Enjoy the vibrant underwater world without needing to dive.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Experience the thrill of various water sports activities.

activities.name: Jet Skiing
activities.description: Zoom across the turquoise waters of the Caribbean.

activities.name: Sailing
activities.description: Relax and enjoy the stunning scenery while sailing along the coast.

activityCategories.name: Hiking & Nature Trails
activityCategories.description: Discover the natural beauty of the Cayman Islands on foot.

activities.name: Redcliff Rock National Park Trail
activities.description: Explore the dramatic limestone cliffs and coastal scenery.

equipment.basic: Sunglasses, insect repellent, reusable water bottle
